title: Infragluteal fasciocutaneous flap for management of recurrent ischial pressure sore
patient: A 17-year-old male suffering from paraplegia due to meningomyelocele presented with right-sided ischial pressure sore (4 cm × 6 cm) for the past 5 years. He was managed by gluteal rotation flap followed by recurrence after 9 months of surgery. Pressure sore was surgically debrided, ostectomy was done and 3 cycles of NPWT were given. Infragluteal fasciocutaneous flap (6 cm × 18 cm) along with gracilis muscle flap was used for resurfacing and filling cavity following bursectomy. Donor area was primarily closed. Sutures were removed on the 2nd week.
